title: Real Madrid 'want Jadon Sancho and will compete with Man Utd for Erling Braut Haaland too'
text:
Real Madrid are reportedly set for a big push in the transfer market and are targeting both Jadon Sancho and Erling Braut Haaland.

Sancho has had a meteoric rise in the game ever since his move to Borussia Dortmund from Manchester City for £8million in 2017 and he has seen his stock rise to a £100m-plus player.

Meanwhile, Haaland has rocketed into the spotlight this season with Red Bull Salzburg, scoring 19 goals across 16 games in all competitions.

Jadon Sancho has continued last season's form into this, scoring three goals in seven games

And according to El Desmarque, Real Madrid are looking to strengthen their squad and are keeping their eyes on both wonderkids.

The report adds that they won't be alone in their interest, however, and that Manchester United are also in the hunt for both players.

Sancho was the centre of transfer speculation in the summer with several clubs including Real Madrid and Manchester United both interested.

It came after the 19-year-old proved to be a revelation in Dortmund's 2018-19 season scoring 12 goals and led the Bundesliga with 14 assists. He has broken into the England team and continued his good form this season with three goals in the opening seven league games for Dortmund.

Haaland, son of former Manchester City, Leeds United and Nottingham Forest defender Alfe-Inge Haaland joined Salzburg in January 2019.

The 19-year-old has starred in the Austrian Bundesliga and Champions League, almost helping the side to a famous comeback against Liverpool in a game they lost 4-3.

Haaland's current contract at Salzburg runs until the summer of 2023, but it is difficult to envisage him staying at the club for the duration of his deal if he continues to perform to such a high standard.
description: Real Madrid are set for a big push in the transfer market and are eyeing both Jadon Sancho and Erling Braut Haaland. Manchester United are also reported to be interested in the pair.
